title: How to Calculate Your Retirement Number in Under 60 Seconds
subtitle: Quickly determine the amount you'll need for a comfortable retirement with this simple formula.
content:
How to Calculate Your Retirement Number in Under 60 Seconds

I'm Tyler, a former financial advisor and portfolio manager. If any of this is helpful, sign up for my free weekly newsletter by clicking the link on my bio.

1. What Will You Spend Per Year?

Start by determining what you plan to spend per year. Let's say it's $70,000.

2. Add a Margin of Safety

Add a 15% margin of safety. Call it $80,500.

3. Multiply by 20

Multiply that number by 20, because I feel okay spending about 5% of my assets per year in retirement. This brings us up to $1.61 million.

4. Consider Social Security

If you have Social Security, subtract around $30,000 a year from your total.

5. Determine Your Target

Reach a target between $1 million and $1.2 million that you should have across your brokerage accounts and retirement accounts.

6. Account for Liabilities

And don't forget, this is net debt. Make sure you always account for any liabilities you currently have and try to take care of those before you lose that stable paycheck.
